column5: Went with my 2 year old son for just 1:30 hour tonight to Oakville. Would have been more but took me for ever to get around the closed streets in downtown Oakville. Water still cold - 51-52 degrees in 35 to 100 feet. Tons of fish and bait fish in 30 to 60 fow. But tough bite. Gote one small salmon so my son was happy and that was it. Tried all colors nothing. This just confirmed my opinion not to go fishing in the PM...never seem to do well at that time of the day. I guess the tough fishing on the North Shore will go on for a while longer....until water gets warmer. Anyhow...hope for much better day tomorrow on Erie ;-)  Here is my happy captain:    Cheers, Ice Fisherman
That is just awesome. I love reading posts like this.
It's always nice to get the little ones out on the water. I'm glad the little guy got to see a fish, even though it wasn't exactly what dad was looking for.
midnight madness closed the streets in downtown oakville tonight.  even though it may have been a tough trip to the water i must say that the pic of your son is absolutetly priceless!  cheers!
ahhhhh good ol' midnight madness.  it's been yrs since i've attended that.  can be a rought time driving around downtown when its on.  great to see another little one enjoying getting out.  Ryan

aaah, thats such a cute picture... congrats, glad to see you at least got a fish to keep the little one smiling... and Congrat's to you again, I hear you've got another little one on the way Ice... WTG
great picture of the little guy.He looks very proud
His smile says it all Emil!!
